title: Wheel rolling on a rough surface

content.question: At time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, the wheel shown in the diagram has clockwise rotation with an angular speed of <math alttext="20 radians per second" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>rad</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>. The center of mass of the wheel is initially moving to the right at <math alttext="2 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>. The wheel rolls on a flat rough surface and has a radius of <math alttext="0.2 meter" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.2</mn><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>. Which of the following is correct about the type of motion, the angular speed, and the linear speed of the wheel at time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>?

choices.label: The type of motion is rolling with slipping, the angular speed remains the same, and the linear speed is decreasing.
The type of motion is rolling with slipping, the angular speed is decreasing, and the linear speed is increasing.
The type of motion is rolling with slipping, the angular speed is decreasing, and the linear speed is decreasing.
The type of motion is rolling without slipping, the angular speed is increasing, and the linear speed is increasing.
The type of motion is rolling without slipping, the angular speed is decreasing, and the linear speed is decreasing.

content.answer: The type of motion is rolling with slipping, the angular speed is decreasing, and the linear speed is increasing.
